verses.verse: When he had come down from the mountain, large crowds followed him.
"Look! A leper came and worshiped him saying, "Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean."
Jesus put out his hand and touched him saying, "I am willing, be clean." Instantly his leprosy was cleansed.
"Jesus said to him, "See to it that you tell no one, nevertheless make your way, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, for a testimony to them."
As Jesus entered into Capernaum, a centurion came to him, pleading with him.
Saying, "Lord, my servant lies at home, paralyzed and tormented with intense, violent pain".
Jesus said to him, "I will come and heal him."
The centurion replied and said, "Lord, I am not worthy that you should come under my roof. Just only speak the word, and my servant will be healed.
"For I am a man under authority, having soldiers under me. I say to one, "Go," and he goes; and to another, "Come," and he comes; and to my servant, "Do this," and he does it."
When Jesus heard this he marveled and said to those who followed, "Truly, I say to you, I have not found such great faith, not even in Israel.
"I say to you that many will come from the east and the west and will sit down with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the Kingdom of Heaven.
"But the children of the kingdom will be thrown out into outer darkness. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth."
Jesus said to the centurion, "Go you way, as you have believed, let it be done for you". His servant was healed in that very hour.
When Jesus had come into Peter's house, he saw his wife's mother bedridden and sick with a fever.
He touched her hand and the fever left her. She got up and served them.
When evening had come, they brought to him many who were possessed with devils, and he throw out the spirits with a word and healed all who were sick,
so that it might be fulfilled what was spoken by Isaiah the prophet saying: He took our infirmities and bore our diseases.
Now when Jesus saw great crowds around him, he gave orders to leave for the other side.
A certain scribe came and said to him, "Master, I will follow you wherever you go."
Jesus said to him, "The foxes have holes and the birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man doesn't have anywhere to lay his head."
Another one of his disciples said to him, "Lord, allow me to first go and bury my father."
But Jesus said to him, "Follow me, and let the dead bury their dead."
He entered a ship; his disciples followed him.
Look! A violent storm rose up on the sea, so much so, that the ship was covered with the waves, but he was asleep.
His disciples came to him and woke him up saying, "Lord, save us, we are dying.
He said to them, "Why, are you afraid, O you of little faith? Then he got up and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a great calm.
But the men were amazed saying, "What kind of man is this that even the winds and the sea obey him?
When he came to the other side into the region of the Gergesenes, two demon-possessed men met him.
And look! They shouted saying, "What do we have to do with you, Jesus, Son of God? Have you come here to torment us before the time?
A ways off from them there was a herd of many pigs feeding, [31] so the devils pleaded with him saying, "If you throw us out, allow us to go into the herd of pigs."
He said to them, "Go". After they came out, they went into the herd of pigs, ran violently down a steep place into the sea, and drowned in the waters.
Those who kept them, ran off and went their separate way into the city and told everything, and what had happened to the one possessed by devils.
And look, the whole city came out to meet Jesus, and when they saw him, they pleaded that he would leave their area.
